meanings.definition: To make a shrill, grating sound by rubbing body parts together, as certain insects do.
meanings.sent1: The cricket was stridulating loudly in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The cicada was stridulating in the hot summer sun.
meanings.sent3: The ants were stridulating in harmony, creating a unique symphony.
meanings.sent4: The rusty gate sounded like it was stridulating in protest.
meanings.sent5: The sound of stridulating insects filled the night with a cacophony of noise.

meanings.definition: The act of producing such a sound.
meanings.sent1: The stridulating of the grasshoppers was a familiar sound in the meadow.
meanings.sent2: The stridulating of the beetles added to the ambiance of the forest.
meanings.sent3: The concert featured a special performance of stridulating by the insect orchestra.
meanings.sent4: The stridulating of the crickets was like a natural alarm clock in the evening.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic stridulating of the insects created a mesmerizing background noise.
